title: SoC COMM_ST 395-0-23 Topics in Communication Studies

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Fan interest in sports has never been more intense or widespread. The sports industry is now a $762 billion business with many organizations generating record revenues from ticket sales, broadcast rights agreements, and corporate sponsorships. At the same time, teams and leagues are facing an increasing amount of domestic and foreign competition, as well as new threats to traditional revenue streams, even as the costs of doing business continue to rise. Complicating matters further, the 24-hour sports news cycle is dominated by issues of ethics and corruption, forcing athletes, teams, and leagues to constantly defend and justify their actions in the face of ongoing crises. This includes innovations in social media and mobile technologies that are allowing teams and leagues to increase the frequency and intensity of interactions with different audiences. Unprecedented challenges are making it more difficult for organizations to meet their objectives. The course will examine how best practice strategies impact areas such as brand identity, digital communication, revenue generation, crisis management, managing the narrative, and place marketing. Students will be evaluated on a midterm and final paper related to developing sports strategies.
